greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers k such that k and 8*k + 1 are both prime.
comment: Solutions of the equation (8*n+1)' + n' = 2, where n' is the arithmetic derivative of n. [_Paolo P. Lava_, Oct 31 2012]
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
program: (MAGMA) [ p: p in PrimesUpTo(1900) | IsPrime(8*p+1) ]; // _Klaus Brockhaus_, Dec 21 2008
xref: Cf. A007519 (primes of form 8n+1), A005123 ((( primes == 1 mod 8 ) - 1)/8). - _Klaus Brockhaus_, Dec 21 2008
results.author: _David W. Wilson_
